resources.string:
An application is susceptible to a denial of service attack if it contains code that, in certain situations, may throw exceptions and the app developer does not handle the exception.
Problem: It is the responsibility of the app developer to handle exceptions explicitly if the code in the app has the potential to throw them under certain conditions. If necessary, a malicious app may attempt to run the portion of the code that raises an exception but is not managed by an app developer by giving some arbitrary inputs.
